website_summaries.verdict: One of Mizuno’s most popular lines goes back to what worked for them in this version of the Rider. With a more form-fitting upper, runners will get to experience again the superb arch support, firm and responsive cushioning, and efficient movement through the gait cycle. This is a very solid option for those looking for a high-mileage trainer that has noticeable stability and shock-absorbing features.
pros: The general consensus from a good number of reviews show that the 18th version of the Rider is a comfortable shoe
It is a value for the money investment
Many comments focused on the spacious toe box for plenty of toe splay
The Rider 18 is relatively lightweight for a neutral trainer
A handful loved the pop coming from the midsole
The heel to toe transition is quick, according to several runners
cons: Quite a few runners saw the soles of the Rider 18 getting separated from the upper
Several disliked the firmness of the ride
Some were disappointed because it required a break-in period

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for me, very comfy but stitching never lasts that long (heavy wear from me).
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect for me. I re-order the same ones all the time (I'm a fitness instructor and runner). However, it's important to visit a specialist before purchasing online to ensure you're getting the correct shoe for your feet and running style. Overall though Mizuno are a fantastic brand, only downside is the stitching never seems to last long.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Loves these trainers, they fit well, look good and are very, very comfortable. I walk to and from work each day - a total daily walk of over 5 miles. I also go out walking at weekends so I need something that's a good fit and easy on the feet. These shoes tick all the boxes. Will definitely buy these again when I've walked my current pair into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs S L Baxter

customer_reviews.title: A very comfortable running shoe for road running
customer_reviews.text: Bought this exact pair before and since they had served their purpose well didn't hesitate to get them again. Fits well, no chaffing at all from the beginning. A very comfortable running shoe for road running.
customer_reviews.author: Siebenschwein

customer_reviews.title: A satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I already have a pair of Mizuno Wave Rider 18 which fit perfectly, I just wanted a different colour. The new pair were perfect in size and colour as pictured. Now that I've found the right trainers for my fairly slim feet I will be ordering more in the future. By the way, I'm 73 and not a runner but can now walk miles in comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mavis Birch

customer_reviews.title: Would definetly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit as expected. Use them at the gym but also for long walks, very light and you feel the air going through when running. Would definetly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Z

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes for the neutral runners foot
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes for the neutral runners foot, fitting is ok , very comfortable.Good for my training , I have improved my 10 K time.
customer_reviews.author: Nico 👍

customer_reviews.title: ... wave rider 18 for the last 3 year very good shoe fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: keep buying the same wave rider 18 for the last 3 year very good shoe fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: S A FENWICK

customer_reviews.title: shoes are comfortable, great fit
customer_reviews.text: shoes are comfortable, great fit, and good support, however they should be a bit more soft inside. if you do fitness and not running, gym workout or boxing, they are a bit hard and can give a kind of sore to feet.
customer_reviews.author: camilla

customer_reviews.title: always a fantastic shoe.
customer_reviews.text: have worn thi shoe for 8yrs ...always a fantastic shoe..perfect fit.....smooth light glides
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: Great colours, poor fit
customer_reviews.text: Had to send back, unable to tie the laces, just didn't fit properly
customer_reviews.author: Chattyali

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fantastic shoes seller was very prompt and my running shoes arrived well packed.Thankyou
customer_reviews.author: pauline Tams

customer_reviews.title: Would buy more
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes, very comfortable and offer just the right level of support.
customer_reviews.author: S Gibson

customer_reviews.title: These are by far my favourite running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favourite running shoe , I have worn mizuno for the past 5 years and this model is the best , they are super comfy , they look smart and are a big improvement from the 17. Love them !!!
customer_reviews.author: sarah hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my older Wave riders with this pair and they fit perfectly and great for my running.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Always wear this brand and style of trainers so to get them for such a good price was a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B. A. Mills

customer_reviews.title: ... of these so I bought her ones and she's super happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My mum been wanting one of these so I bought her ones and she's super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great trainers. Very comfortable, Look good, excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs T A Coombes

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: These are the best trainers I've ever had. Lightweight, extremely comfortable, well made, not a single issue with them. I run, weight train and cycle in them. They've been through tough mudder and come out of the machine like new! I had the turquoise ones and have just ordered a replacement pair in black/silver. Not that the old ones are anywhere near finished with! Was delighted to find them In the sale for half price, result! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that there is some rubbing on the inside of my left foot near the arch - where the shoe fabric is thicker due to the Mizuno flash. The last Wave Rider design was much better because the flash was just printed on the fabric so no extra layer to thicken the fabric. I'm hoping that through use it will ease up - run about 17 miles so far. Apart from that they feel supportive and look good!
customer_reviews.author: Eve Mc

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too narrow as usual in womens trainers
customer_reviews.text: Loved these but as usual with ladies shoes they were too narrow for me. Had to get the men's ones instead which although nice didn't have the gorgeous mint colour I wanted so much. A real shame. I wish trainers came in wide sizes for women in good colours and then I would have far more choices. Not every girl has dainty narrow feet!!! So rating them for style and not for fit. I should add the price was fantastic and they arrived the next day which was excellent. Just a downer I had to return them straight away and pay double for men's instead.
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Love the colour
customer_reviews.text: See slightly bigger than the old ones I had of similar model (16) but decided to keep and have been for first run in them and felt great. Good value. Arrived next day- great. Not loads of packaging either like some deliveries :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serious running shoe at reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Yet another pair of Mizuno Wave riders for me - I just love them. This version 18 is more comfy in the toe as it does not have the double seam that some previous models had which tended to catch a little - so this is my 2nd pair of the v18 bought this year. Light but provide good cushioning, especially in the front foot (fore-foot) - once I changed to Mizuno Waves I said goodbye to achy knees.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Ive had at least 3 consecutive pairs of mizuno trainers which have fitted like slippers from the outset - great as i do loads of walking. However this last pair sadly disappointed. They rubbed on the inside of each heel particularly the right. Once id worn them i couldnt sent them back. I had to wear them everyother day to try and break them in. Ive never had to break trainers in. Even after 3 - 4 weeks they still rub slightly in the right foot. The reduced price certainly make you wonder if they are a reduced quality product. I won't be purchasing again and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fenton

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this every time for your first pair
customer_reviews.text: I had these trainers professionally fitted first. I would recommend this every time for your first pair. Then after this I have bought the same shoes again and again. They are great. The only annoying thing is that sometimes if you are running on gravel, a chunky stone can get perfectly wedged in the gap in the centre of the heel. V annoying!! I wish they could fix this!
customer_reviews.author: Owen

product_meta.title: Mizuno Wave Rider 18, Women's Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Cushioning and stability from preceding versions is retained and expanded upon with the Mizuno Wave Rider 18 Women's Running Shoes through a redesigned upper which sees several overlays removed to offer greater freedom in the forefoot. Finer mesh detailing works with the honeycombing of Mizuno's Intercool technology to deliver even more breathability with an internal structure that conforms to your running stride, in turn improving both fit and comfort. SR Touch again features, but this time lighter. A softer heel with cushioning compound giving yielding improved impact resistance upon heelstrike and a much smoother transition period. The Mizuno U4iC Wave midsole has been designed to be unlike comparable shoe technologies. When the foot touches the ground, Wave attenuates and redirects impact forces away from the foot. Acting much like a car's suspension, it cushions and keeps the foot centred in the shoe throughout the stride. Through the use of differing wave shapes and designs, Mizuno are ultimately equipping each model to fit the unique stride of the individual runner; if its a local jog or running past the 20 mile marker, Wave will always feel amazing underfoot. Research carried out by Mizuno has indicated that there is a significant difference between the biomechanics of the male and female running gait. Tests revealed that the angle, velocity and speed of pronation is higher in women than in men. Research has also found that the transition from foot strike to toe off is slower in men than in women and that the angle at which the heel contacts the ground is more severe in women than in men. As such, Mizuno products employ specific male/female designs that accommodate these differences.
